DOC.brief_summary: The presented study is designed to prove efficacy of the anti-gravity treadmill (alter G®) compared to a standard rehabilitation protocol in patients with tibial plateau or ankle fractures with six weeks of partial weight bearing.
DOC.brief_title: Postoperatively Treated Patients With Lower Limb Fracture With or Without an Anti-gravity Treadmill
DOC.criteria: patients with a postoperative partial weight bearing after tibial plateau or ankle fracture. man and woman of an age between 18 and 65 Body weight more than 100kg serious illness or poor general health as judged by physician that may influence the rehabilitation open fractures (>1° according to Gustilo and Anderson) surgical site infection pregnancy neuromuscular disorders or preexisting muscle atrophy.
